definition: nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Article 51. Normative documents shall be valid for five years.
sentences.chinese: 第五十一条规范性文件有效期为5年。

sentences.english: Admittedly, all disciplines have a normative orientation.
sentences.chinese: 诚然，所有学科都有一种规范性导向。

sentences.english: Off-exchange transactions may be less regulated or subject to a separate regulatory regime.
sentences.chinese: 也许规范性较低或属于不同的政体。

sentences.english: Normative document containing reformative measures shall be approved by the municipal government.
sentences.chinese: 推行改革措施的规范性文件，必须经市政府批准。

sentences.english: Lastly, present some epistemic difficulties of the epistemic normativity of scientific knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 然后提出一些科学知识的认识规范性的认知困境。

sentences.english: Make monetary policy less discretionary and more rule-like.
sentences.chinese: 降低货币政策的任意性使之更具规范性。

sentences.english: It resolves the teaching and criterions of the teaching materials store.
sentences.chinese: 着力解决了教学素材库的教学性和规范性问题。

sentences.english: The independence and specification of supervisory system.
sentences.chinese: 四是监察权的独立性和规范性。

sentences.english: Any departmental regulatory document shall be examined and decided by the department executive meeting.
sentences.chinese: 部门规范性文件应当经部门办公会议审议决定。

sentences.english: The texts of normative documents published in government gazettes shall be the official texts.
sentences.chinese: 在政府公报上公布的规范性文件文本为标准文本。

sentences.english: Normativity and impartiality are the indispensable points that the editors mush observe.
sentences.chinese: 规范性和公正性是科技期刊编辑的职业道德品格。

definition: norm/standard/specification/regulation/rule/within the rules/to fix rules/to regulate/to specify
